snippet: A bill in Wisconsin to authorize a hunting season on wolves is opposed by Indian tribes on sacred principle and tradition.
abstract: Bill introduced by the Wisconsin Legislature to authorize a hunting season on wolves has attracted criticism from wildlife biologists and opposition from the Great Lakes Indian Fish and Game Commission, who represent 11 tribes of Ojibwe Native Americans; testimony states that a hunt would violate the religious traditions of the Ojibwe, who hold the wolf as sacred.
lead_paragraph: A bill in Wisconsin to authorize a hunting season on wolves is opposed by Indian tribes on sacred principle and tradition.

headline.seo: Science, Faith and Politics Clash Over Wolves in Wisconsin
headline.main: Before Wolves May Be Hunted, Science, Faith and Politics Clash
headline.print_headline: Before Wolves May Be Hunted, Science, Faith and Politics Clash
